Replace.Text: Great Barrier Reef
Two tile natural wonder that can be found on coastal terrain and provides +3 [ICON_Food] Food and +2 [ICON_Science] Science. Major adjacency bonus to the Campus district.
Cliffs of Dover
Two tile natural wonder. It appears with Cliffs adjacent to water and provides +3 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +2 [ICON_Food] Food. Improvements cannot be placed on it.
Crater Lake
One tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +5 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +1 [ICON_Science] Science, and Fresh Water.
Dead Sea

Two tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture. Units heal completely if they heal for one turn adjacent to the Dead Sea. Does not provide Fresh Water.
Mount Everest
Three tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to adjacent tiles. Religious units who move next to Mount Everest ignore Hills for the rest of the game.
Galápagos Islands
Two tile impassable natural wonder. It appears on coastal terrain and provides +2 [ICON_Science] Science to adjacent tiles.
Mount Kilimanjaro
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_Food] Food to adjacent tiles.
Pantanal
Four tile natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_Food] Food and +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Piopiotahi
Three tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold to adjacent tiles.
Torres del Paine
Two tile impassable natural wonder. Doubles the terrain yields of all adjacent tiles.
Tsingy de Bemaraha
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Science] Science to adjacent tiles.
Yosemite
Two tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Science] Science to adjacent tiles.
Chocolate Hills
Four tile natural wonder. It provides +1 [ICON_Food] Food, +2 [ICON_Production] Production, and +1 [ICON_Science] Science.
Delicate Arch
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to adjacent tiles.
Eye of the Sahara
Three tile natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. After the game reaches the Atomic Era it provides an additional +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +3 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science.
Eyjafjallajökull
Adjacent plots yield +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +2 [ICON_Food] Food.
Gobustan
Three tile natural wonder. It provides +3 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +1 [ICON_Production] Production.
Hạ Long Bay

Two tile natural wonder that can be found on coastal terrain and provides +3 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. +15 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending in this tile.
Ik-Kil
One tile impassable natural wonder. +50% [ICON_Production] Production when producing wonders and districts in adjacent tiles. It provides Fresh Water.
Lake Retba
Two tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. Does not provide Fresh Water.
Lysefjord
Naval combat units that enter adjacent plots are granted their next promotion. Adjacent plots yield +1 [ICON_Production] Production.
Mato Tipila
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith and +1 [ICON_Production] Production to adjacent tiles.
Mount Roraima
Four tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith and +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science to adjacent tiles.
Mount Vesuvius

One tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Volcano and provides +1 [ICON_Production] Production to adjacent tiles. On Eruption it gives high yields to adjacent tiles, but large [ICON_Citizen] Population loss. It is always active.
Pamukkale

Two tile impassable natural wonder. +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity. It provides an additional [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity if adjacent to an Entertainment Complex. Major adjacency bonus to Theater Square, Campus, and Commercial Hub districts. Standard adjacency bonus to the Holy Site district. It provides Fresh Water.
Sahara el Beyda
Four tile natural wonder. It provides +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science, +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture, and +4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Ubsunur Hollow
Four tile natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith, +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food, and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Uluru
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith to adjacent tiles. Provides +4 Appeal to adjacent tiles instead of the usual +2.
Zhangye Danxia
Three tile impassable natural wonder. Provides 2 [ICON_GREATGENERAL] Great General points and 2 [ICON_GREATMERCHANT] Great Merchant points if you own at least one of these tiles.
